intro: Paronychia franciscana, commonly known as the California sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. It has a compact growth habit and produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in the spring. Paronychia franciscana is adapted to dry conditions and is considered a rare species due to its limited distribution.
